Title: EU Commission revives prospects for Caspian countries to export gas to Europe
Description: The 10 bn m3 Trans-Adriatic Pipeline (TAP) linking Azerbaijan’s Caspian Sea gas reserves to South-eastern Europe represents an economic opportunity for others in the Caspian region to secure new gas export markets as the European Union’s demand for non-Russian pipeline gas will keep growing, EU energy commissioner Kadri Simson announced a regional ministerial meeting on Friday.
Author: DE

Title: EU LNG imports in January fall from December’s all-time high
Description: LNG imports into the European Union dropped in January from their all-time high reached in December. Warm temperatures in the first half of the month coupled with multi-year-high underground gas stock levels capped demand for LNG. The EU increased its reliance on LNG to replace most of the lost Russian pipeline supplies which used to be its main source of supply prior to 2022.
Author: DE

Title: LNG deliveries at Germany’s Brunsbuttel and Lubmin terminals further delayed
Description: Germany’s floating LNG terminal in Brunsbuttel is expected to start sending gas into the country’s grid by the end of February instead of early February as previously planned, while Lubmin's next cargo delivery keeps being delayed, with strong winds in the region likely to play a role. Germany relies on these new terminals to help replace the lost Russian pipeline supplies and reinforce its security of supply.
Author: DE

Title: Freeport LNG requests approval to dock and load ships as restart plan continues apace
Description: US LNG project operator Freeport LNG has submitted its request to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to return the Loop 1 LNG transfer piping to service and dock and load ships from its Dock 1 LNG berth at its idled 15 mtpa plant on Quintana Island, Texas, as its plan to resume production and exports gathers pace.
Author: CK
